body.p: TAYLOR HIGH-SCHOOL Jeanette Stevens Last week a new ceiling was plac- ed in the main assembly, storage room and typing room. The pupils were seated in the halls and different class rooms. The typists were also placed in the halls. There has been a great number of absentees this week. We will be glad to see them return to school soon. All of the freshman girls in the Home Economics class are anxious to start making their dresses so Miss Rendall came to the conclusion that they would start next week. Last week the sophomore Home Ec. class had an experiment. They were shown how and also helped to dress a chicken. The chicken was donated by Verna Jacobson. This week the American history class prepared a map showing how the United States grew. Shown on the map were the original 13 states; Louisiana Purchase, Texas Annexa- tion; Spanish Cession of 1819; Gads- den Purchase; First Mexican Ces- sion; and the territory in Washing- ton, Oregon and Idaho secured by dis- covery, exploration, and settlement. This work pointed out to the history students how our country was enlarg- ed through the growth of territory. English— The sophomores have finished the study of verbals. Next week they will take up “As You Like It” after a quiz and participles, gerunds and in- finitives. The freshmen are busily working learning differentiation of pronouns in the accusative and nominative case. The Juniors and Senior American Literature class finished their essay contract Friday. Every one in the class did sufficient supplementary work to warrant him an A or 6 grade. The local declamation and oration contest will be held March 24. The league contest in which Hixton, Mel- rose, Alma Center and Taylor will | participate is to be held on March 31. Taylor will act as host this year. Ernest Rumppe Independence captured first place at the tournament by winning from Alma Center, Taylor and Blair re- spectively. Blair took second place by beating Trempealeau and Whitehall but lost the final to Independence. Third place went to Taylor who defeated Arkansaw and Whitehall while being the victim of the Inde- pendence team. Consolation went to Alma Center who beat Arkansaw and Hixton while losing to Independence. Chet Johnson of Alma Center scor- ed the most points at the tournament: he had 28 points in three games. Duane Lambert of Taylor, scored the most points in a single game by registering 13 points against Arkan- saw. Clayton Waller played his last game of basket ball against high school competition when he left the floor after Taylor-Whitehall game. His record for the past years are as follows: Freshman 4 pts.; Sopho- more 19 pts.; Junior 44 pts.; and Senior 131 pts. He scored a total j of 198 pts. during his high school | career. He played guard the first ! three years and took up playing for- | ward in his last year and did a nice j job you must admit Taylor’s bas- ket ball team will miss him and the | person who takes his place will find . that position hard to fill as Clayton filled it. The Independence team will be hit | hard next year by graduation, for six players will be graduated.
